p: We considered three prototypic network models to represent population contact structure: the Erdős-Rényi (ER) random graph [ 24], the Barabási-Albert (BA) graph [ 25] and the Watts-Strogatz (WS) graph [ 26] with low rewiring probability ( Fig 1). These three networks are characterized by different degree distributions and amount of clustering. The degree of a node in a network is the number of connections to other nodes it has and the degree distribution is the probability distribution of these degrees over the whole network.
